Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of the issue by only focusing on the level of state funding for education and not addressing other factors that may affect the quality of education.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough supporting evidence or data to fully prove the assertion that there is more state funding for education today than at any other time.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that increased state funding automatically translates to improved education outcomes, which may not necessarily be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the perceived increase in state funding for education, such as inflation or changes in budget allocation.
